How to Read Well | Dr. Karen Swallow Prior | Ep. #275
description:
Karen Swallow Prior earned her Ph.D. in English at the State University of New York at Buffalo. She is a popular writer and speaker, as well as a columnist for Religion News Service. Her writing has appeared in The New York Times, The Atlantic, Vox, The Washington Post, Christianity Today, and many other places. Her most recent book is The Evangelical Imagination: How Stories, Images, and Metaphors Created a Culture in Crisis (Brazos, 2023). God's Grandeur & The Case For Intelligent Design | Dr. Brian Miller | Ep. #266
description:
In this interview, I chat with Dr. Brian Miller about the Case for Intelligent Design. Brian Miller is research coordinator for the Center for Science and Culture at Discovery Institute. He holds a B.S. in physics with a minor in engineering from MIT and a Ph.D. in physics from Duke University. He speaks internationally on the topics of intelligent design and the impact of worldviews on society, and is a primary organizer of the Conference on Engineering in the Life Sciences (CELS). He also has consulted on organizational development and strategic planning, and he is a founding member of an innovation consortium that developed into TheStartup, a virtual incubator dedicated to bringing innovation to the marketplace. He has contributed to multiple books and journals covering the debate over intelligent design, including The Mystery of Life's Origin: The Continuing Controversy, The Comprehensive Guide to Science and Faith, and Inference Review. 

Check out the book and the Sophia Institute!

Link for Purchase: https://sophiainstitute.com/product/gods-grandeur/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SophiaInstitutePress/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/SophiaPress

title: Fundamentalist Apologetics (Dr. Randal Rauser)
A Problem with How Christians May Have Used Violent Texts (Dr. L. Daniel Hawk)
William Hasker: The People, Events, and Ideas that Shaped Him (Great Thinkers, #1)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Dr. William Hasker about his life, his career, and the people, events, and ideas that shaped him.

Dr. Hasker received his Ph.D. in theology and philosophy of religion from The University of Edinburgh. A distinguished scholar, Dr. Hasker has published numerous works; his book on the problem of evil, The Triumph of God Over Evil, was published in 2008 by InterVarsity. Earlier works include Providence, Evil, and the Openness of God (Routledge 2004), The Emergent Self, (Cornell University Press, 1999), Reason and Religious Belief: An Introduction to the Philosophy of Religion (Oxford University Press, co-authored) and God, Time, and Knowledge (Cornell University Press).

His Books: https://www.amazon.com/Books-William-Hasker/s?rh=n%3A283155%2Cp_27%3AWilliam+Hasker

Great Thinkers Series: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLj8S949x_pmTeJWbeWyeN0JNAvBZJEzBB&si=e2HnkH4Y95hAikZy

title: The Old Testament God is Morally Perfect | Dr. Paul Copan | Ep. #248
description:
Dr. Paul Copan joined me to chat about Old Testament Ethics, and his new book, Is God a Vindictive Bully? We chat about slavery, difficult passages, how to interpret the Old Testament, and so much more!

Paul Copan (Ph.D., Philosophy, Marquette University) is a Christian theologian, analytic philosopher, apologist, and author. He is currently a professor at the Palm Beach Atlantic University (Florida) and holds the endowed Pledger Family Chair of Philosophy and Ethics.

His Website: http://www.paulcopan.com/about/

The Book: https://www.amazon.com/God-Vindictive-Bully-Reconciling-Portrayals/dp/1540964558/ref=sr_1_1?crid=TUB5EE28LID1&keywords=is+god+a+vindictive+bully+by+paul+copan&qid=1685375777&sprefix=is+god+a+vin%2Caps%2C289&sr=8-1

title: Graham Oppy Defines Theism ⛪️
What are Ameliorative Definitions? 🧠
Quantum Mechanics Intuitively Leads to Idealism 🧬
One Hell of a Problem for Divine Love (w/ Dr. Ryan Mullins) (Ep. #233)
description:
R.T. Mullins (PhD, University of St Andrews). He has published over 50 essays on various topics in philosophical theology related to models of God, philosophy of time, personal identity, the problem of evil, disability theology, the Trinity, and the incarnation. In this interview, I chat with Ryan about his paper, One Hell of a Problem for Divine Love.

The paper: https://philpapers.org/rec/MULOHO

description:

Andrew Hronich is a student at Princeton Theological Seminary. Jim has authored numerous books and articles on issues in ethics, aesthetics, philosophy of religion, and popular culture, including the award-winning How to Be Good in a World Gone Bad.

title: God, Atheism, Heaven & Hell: A Conversation with Scott Clifton (Ep. #213)
description:
Scott Clifton is an actor and an atheist who has a deep interest in the philosophy of religion. In this interview, I chat with Scott about non-belief, heaven, hell, and reasons to doubt God's existence. I provide pushback to some of Scott's key contentions in a (hopefully) friendly way!

Scott's Channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheoreticalBullshit

title: Why is There Suffering? How You Can Decide (w/ Dr. Bethany Sollereder) (Ep. #212)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Dr. Bethany Sollereder about her new book, "Why is There Suffering?" We chat about how you can make a path trying to explain why there is suffering. Bethany Sollereder (PhD, University of Exeter) is a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Oxford. The author of God, Evolution, and Animal Suffering, she writes regularly for journals and popular publications including Christian Century and BioLogos.org.

Bethany's Book: https://www.amazon.com/Why-There-Suffering-Theological-Expedition/dp/0310109027#:~:text=In%20her%20new%20book%2C%20%22Why,research%20fellow%20at%20Oxford%20University.

title: Paradoxes Prove Causal Finitism? The Pros and Cons (w/@MajestyofReason) (Ep. #208)
description:
Philosopher Joe Schmid joins me to talk about casual finitism. We chat about his recent paper on arguments for casual finitism and some of Joe's concerns about casual finitism. 

Joe's Paper: https://philpapers.org/rec/SCHASA-26

Timestamps:
0:00 Opening
0:58 Introduction
3:14 CF — Causal Finitism
5:30 The paper. 
19:04 LRP — Littlewood Ross paradox 
27:55 TLP — Thompson’s Lamp Paradox 
34:36 JLU — Joes Laser Urn (I took the liberty of naming it, maybe it has another name in the article.)
38:10 Elevator pitch of the arguments.
42:48 Six Reasons against CF
1:14:00 Wrapping up!

title: Why You Are a Soul: A Defense of Dualism (w/ Dr. Charles Taliaferro) (Ep. #204)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Charles Taliaferro about dualism, the mind, and problems with physicalism. Charles Taliaferro is an American philosopher specializing in theology and philosophy of religion. He is an emeritus professor of philosophy at St. Olaf College, a senior research fellow at the Institute for Faithful Research, and a member of the Royal Institute of Philosophy. 

His Books: https://www.amazon.com/Charles-Taliaferro/e/B001IYXGBC%3Fref=dbs_a_mng_rwt_scns_share

title: Why Christians Should be Intellectually Rigorous (w/ Dr. Kenneth Samples) (Ep. #185)
description:
Philosopher and theologian Kenneth Richard Samples has a great passion to help people understand the reasonableness and relevance of Christianity’s truth claims. He is the senior research scholar at Reasons to Believe and the author of several books, including Classic Christian Thinkers, 7 Truths That Changed the World, and God Among Sages. In this interview, we talk about the importance of intellectual rigor for Christians.

More About Ken: https://reasons.org/team/kenneth-r-samples

title: Why the Fall Cannot Fully Account for Animal Suffering (w/ Dr. Bethany Sollereder)

title: Are UFOs the Demonic Presence? w/ Dr. Hugh Ross (Ep. #170)
description:
Astrophysicist Hugh Ross, founder and president of Reasons to Believe, holds a degree in physics from the University of British Columbia and a PhD in astronomy from the University of Toronto. His books include Weathering Climate Change, The Creator and the Cosmos, and Improbable Planet. Hugh has also spoken on hundreds of university campuses as well as at conferences and churches around the world.

In this interview, I talk with Dr. Ross about UFOs and their potential implications within Christian theology. 

More info about Dr. Ross: https://reasons.org/team/hugh-ross

title: Love Explains Evolution? The Problem of Animal Suffering (w/ Dr. Bethany Sollereder) (Ep. #169)
description:
Bethany Sollereder is a Research Fellow at the Laudato Si’ Research Institute at Campion Hall. She specializes in theology concerning evolution and the problem of suffering and is currently working on the theological aspects of our changing climate. In this interview, we talk about the problems of animal suffering, evolutionary evil, and general treatments of the problem of evil.

God, Evolution, and Animal Suffering: https://www.amazon.com/God-Evolution-Animal-Suffering-Routledge-ebook/dp/B07K2FWD6Q

title: Evolution is Beautiful? An Aesthetic Theodicy for Animal Suffering (w/ Dr. John Haught) (Ep. #168)
description:
John F. Haught (Ph. D. Catholic University, 1970) is a Distinguished Research Professor, Georgetown University, Washington DC.  In this interview, I talk with Dr. Haught about evolutionary theory and its relationship to Christian Theism. Is evolution evidence against God? How can it be seen in the light of Biblical teaching?

Learn more about Dr. Haught: https://gufaculty360.georgetown.edu/s/contact/00336000014TkWYAA0/john-haught

title: A Scientist Explains Why Evolution May be Evidence for God (w/ Dr. Sy Garte) (Ep. #167)
description:
Sy (Seymour) Garte, PhD in biochemistry, is the author of the award-winning book The Works of His Hands: A Scientist’s Journey from Atheism to Faith (Kregel Publications, 2019). He has been a tenured professor at New York University, Rutgers University, and the University of Pittsburgh, division director at the Center for Scientific Review of the National Institutes of Health, and interim vice president for research at the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences.

In this interview, I talk with Sy about evolution and Christianity. Is evolution contra Christian teaching? Is evolution really random? And much more!

Follow Sy: https://twitter.com/sygarte?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor

title: How Memory Theory & 1 Corinthians 15 Support the Resurrection (w/ David Graieg) (Ep. #160)
description:
David Graieg studied Electrical Engineering at the University of Western Australia and Theology at Dallas Theological Seminary. He is currently undertaking a PhD. David has taught apologetics in Singapore and teaches apologetics with Alphacrucis College in Australia. He runs a Reasonable Faith chapter in Perth https://www.reasonablefaithperth.org/ David is married to Grace, and they have three young children.

In this interview, I talk with David about his dissertation on memory theory and its impact on the case for the resurrection, focusing on the creed in 1 Corinthians 15.

title: Is the Gospel of John History? (w/ Dr. Lydia McGrew) (Ep. #151)
description:
Dr. Lydia McGrew is a widely published analytic philosopher and author. She received her PhD in English from Vanderbilt University in 1995. She has published extensively in the theory of knowledge, specializing in formal epistemology and in its application to the evaluation of testimony and to the philosophy of religion. 

In this conversation, we talk about your recent book, The Eye of the Beholder and the reliability of John's Gospel.

Dr. McGrew's channel:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSwhBk0vUSg_6prKkR82IDQ/videos

Testify video on unnecessary details:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AzRwsDDGEOY

Testify video on unexplained allusions:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5mF9LbMs40&t=4s

Purchase link for Hidden in Plain View:

https://www.amazon.com/Hidden-Plain-View-Undesigned-Coincidences/dp/1936341905/ref=cm_cr_arp_d_product_top?ie=UTF8

Purchase link for The Mirror or the Mask:

The Mirror or the Mask: Liberating the Gospels from Literary Devices: McGrew, Lydia: 9781947929074: Amazon.com: Books

Purchase link for The Eye of the Beholder:

The Eye of the Beholder: The Gospel of John as Historical Reportage: McGrew, Lydia: 9781947929159: Amazon.com: Books

title: Faith, Slavery, & Other Objections to Christianity from New Atheism (w/ Kenneth Samples) (Ep. #147)
description:
Philosopher and theologian Kenneth Richard Samples has a great passion to help
people understand the reasonableness and relevance of Christianity’s truth claims. He is the senior research scholar at Reasons to Believe and the author of several books,
including Classic Christian Thinkers, 7 Truths That Changed the World, and God Among Sages. In this interview, I chat with Kenneth about his latest book and questions relating to the rationality, relevance, and goodness of Christianity.

Ken's Book: https://www.amazon.com/Christianity-Cross-Examined-Rational-Relevant-Good-ebook/dp/B093KN4NN6/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&qid=1623345858&refinements=p_27%3AKenneth+Samples&s=digital-text&sr=1-1

title: A Scholar Explains the Book of Exodus (w/ Dr. W. Ross Blackburn) (Ep. #134)
description:
Dr. Ross Blackburn has been ordained for 20 years and has served as Rector of Christ the King for the past 10. He earned a Master of Divinity at Trinity School for Ministry, and a PhD in Biblical Studies at the University of St. Andrews, Scotland. In this interview, we talk about big questions in Exodus such as how it lays a missional foundation.

Dr. Blackburn's church: http://www.christthekingboone.com/

title: Is Intelligent Design a Good Argument for God? (with Dr. Casey Luskin) (Ep. #123)
description:
Casey Luskin has a Ph.D. in Geology from the University of Johannesburg, and a B.S. and M.S. in earth sciences from the University of California at San Diego, where he studied geology and evolution extensively at both the graduate and undergraduate levels. He also has a law degree from the University of San Diego and is a California-licensed attorney. He works at Discovery Institute as Associate Director for the Center for Science and Culture. In this interview, I talk with Casey about the status of intelligent design!

Casey's Website: http://www.caseyluskin.com/

Casey’s Bio: https://www.discovery.org/p/luskin/

Timestamps:
0:00 Intro
1:07 Who is Casey Luskin?
4:10 Background Information
10:14 Interest in ID

27:40 God of the Gaps Objection

title: Examining Divine Simplicity (with Dr. Ryan Mullins) (Ep. #122)
description:
Ryan Mullins has published over 30 essays on various topics in philosophical theology related to models of God, philosophy of time, personal identity, the problem of evil, disability theology, the Trinity, and the incarnation. He has published two books, The End of the Timeless God (Oxford University Press, 2016) and God and Emotion (Cambridge University Press, 2020).

Ryan's Podcast: https://www.rtmullins.com/

title: A Scholar Explains the Book of Genesis (w/ Dr. John Walton) (Ep. #116)
description:
John H. Walton is an Old Testament scholar and Professor at Wheaton College. He specializes in the Ancient Near Eastern backgrounds of the Old Testament, especially Genesis and its creation account, as well as interpretation of Job. In this interview, we talk about big questions in the book of Genesis. 

Timestamps:
0:00 Intro
3:00 Who Wrote Genesis?
5:09 Did Moses Write Genesis?
6:16 When is Genesis Written?
9:07 Why Was Genesis Written?
11:45 Big Ideas in Genesis 
17:37 The Fall
20:00 Why Context Matters
22:05 The Creation Story
26:53 Is Genesis in Conflict w/ Evolution?
32:20 The Flood
38:07 Significance in Genesis 1-11 and 12-50 Division
39:45 Genesis in God's Big Plan
42:30 Jewish Scholarship on Genesis
44:00 Hyperbole vs Universal Language 
45:50 Empiricism and Genesis 
48:00 Has Genesis' Meaning Been Distorted Today?
51:45 God's Cosmic Temple
54:22 Resources on Cultural Context
56:00 Conclusion

title: Paulogia's 4 Steps to Leaving Christianity | Feat. Plantinga's Bulldog & Kerusso Apologetics | RV #4
description:

Original Video: https://youtu.be/79a3jSJ2qg4

title: Does Science Support a Beginning and Fine-Tuning? (with Dr. Michael Strauss) (Ep. #109)
description:
Michael Strauss is an experimental particle physicist currently doing research on the ATLAS detector, one of the two multi-purpose particle detectors located on the Large Hadron Collider at CERN near Geneva, Switzerland. He is also a professor at the University of Oklahoma in Norman since 1995. In this conversation we talk about how science supports arguments for God's existence.

Dr. Strauss' Website: https://www.michaelgstrauss.com/

0:00 Intro
2:25 Fundamental Nature of the Universe
3:40 Science and Faith Relationship
8:02 Scientific Evidence for a Finite Past
13:30 From First Cause to God?
18:42 Infinite Regress?
25:05 Pre-Existing Matter & Energy?
29:40 Oppy's Response
32:06 Science of Fine-Tuning
37:40 Could Constants be Different?
40:00 Empirical Evidence Needed for God?
45:55 Audience Q&A
59:05 Conclusion

title: A New Look at the Cosmological Argument (with Rob Koons) (Ep. #103)
description:
Dr. Rob Koons specializes in philosophical logic and in the application of logic to long-standing philosophical problems, including metaphysics, philosophy of mind and intentionality, semantics, political philosophy and metaethics, and philosophy of religion. In this conversation, we talk about arguments for a first cause and a necessary foundation.

Rob's Website: http://robkoons.net/

0:00 Intro
1:00 Dr. Koons Interest in Philosophy
1:43 General Argument in the Paper
3:40 Difference Between Contingency and Necessity
5:58 Is Everything Necessary? 
8:20 The PSR
11:15 All Parts of a Necessary Fact is Necessary
14:22 No Demonstration of Something Necessary?
16:24 Every Contingent Fact has a Wholly Contingent Part
18:48 All Wholly Contingent Facts have an Explanation?
20:04 Contingent Things in Cosmos mean Cosmos Needs a Cause?
22:06 From Necessary Being to God?
29:36 Audience Q&A
44:18 Conclusion

title: Medieval Christian Mysticism, Marguerite Porete, and Your Theology (with Leighton Ryder) (Ep. #102)
description:
Leighton Ryders writes about Theology, Philosophy, Apologetics, and History. He is a university student who is majoring in History (Honours) and minoring in Religious Studies. More specifically he studies Medieval European Ecclesiastic Reform & Mystic History.

Marguerite Porete was a Beguine mystic burned in 1310 for heresy. We talk about her life, mysticism, women in the church, heresy, heterodoxy, and views of sanctification. 

Leighton's Website: https://academictheist.wixsite.com/admcthst

title: A Philosopher's Son Died. His Thoughts. (with Dr. Khaldoun Aziz Sweis) (Ep. #96)
description:
Khaldoun Aziz Sweis, PhD is former Chair and currently Associate Professor of Philosophy at Olive-Harvey College in Chicago and serves as a tutor in philosophy with Oxford University in England.  He was born in Amman, Jordan.  His experience entails teaching philosophy for over a decade as well as speaking at conferences both nationally and abroad such as Hong Kong, Romania, Australia and England. He has three books, including Debating Christian Theism (Oxford University Press 2011) and the newest being, Killing God: How to Respond to the Seven Most common objections of the New Atheism.  He is a member of the American Philosophical Association.

His Website: https://logicallyfaithful.com/about-me/

Blog: https://www.logicallyfaithful.com/seven-things-evil-is-not-what-the-death-of-my-son-taught-me/

title: Does The Fine-Tuning Argument Work? | Interview with Dr. Luke Barnes (Ep. #76)
description:
Luke A. Barnes is a Lecturer at Western Sydney University, with a Ph.D. in astronomy from the University of Cambridge. The focus of his research has been the cosmic evolution of matter, and he has published papers in the field of galaxy formation and evolution, and on the fine-tuning of the universe for life. He has held Super Science and John Templeton Fellowships, and speaks regularly to public audiences on physics, cosmology and astronomy. He tweets @lukebarnesastro.

In this conversation, I talk with Luke about the fine-tuning argument and answer common objections.

Luke's Book: https://www.amazon.com/Cosmic-Revolutionarys-Handbook-Beat-Bang/dp/1108486703/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=luke+barnes&qid=1602114109&sr=8-1

Follow Luke: https://twitter.com/lukebarnesastro?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor

title: Adam, Eve, and Evolution | Interview with Dr. Joshua Swamidass (Ep. #73)
description:
Dr. S. Joshua Swamidass MD, Ph.D. is a physician, scientist, and Associate Professor of Laboratory and Genomic Medicine at Washington University in Saint Louis. He leads a computational biology group that studies information at the intersection of biology, chemistry, and medicine (http://swami.wustl.edu/).

In this interview, I talk with Joshua about how evolution impacts Theism. We talk about questions like why evolution, who Adam & Eve were, and why believe in God. We will also take your questions at the end!

title: A Scholar Responds to Common Objections to the Gospels | Interview with Dr. Craig Blomberg (Ep. #69)
description:
Dr. Craig Blomberg is Distinguished Professor of New Testament at Denver Seminary in Littleton, Colorado. He holds the B.A. from Augustana College in Rock Island, Illinois, the M.A. from Trinity Evangelical Divinity School in Deerfield, Illinois, and the Ph.D. from the University of Aberdeen, Scotland. Craig is the author of sixteen books and has co-authored or co-edited ten more, along with more than 150 journal articles or chapters in multi-author works. 

In this interview, I talk with Dr. Craig Blomberg about questions relating to the Gospels such as their authorship, textual variants, and other important questions. 

Craig's Books: https://www.amazon.com/s?i=stripbooks&rh=p_27%3ACraig+L.+Blomberg&s=relevancerank&text=Craig+L.+Blomberg&ref=dp_byline_sr_book_1

title: Answering Difficult Questions About Sexuality | Interview with Dr. Christopher Yuan (Ep. #64)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Dr. Christopher Yuan about difficult questions regarding sexuality and culture. We will be talking about homosexuality, transgenderism, and more! Plus, we will be taking your questions!

Dr. Christopher Yuan has taught the Bible at Moody Bible Institute for over ten years and his speaking ministry on faith and sexuality has reached five continents. He speaks at conferences, on college campuses, and in churches. He has co-authored with his mother their memoir, Out of a Far Country: A Gay Son’s Journey to God, A Broken Mother’s Search for Hope (100,000 copies sold and now in seven languages). He is also the author of Giving a Voice to the Voiceless. Christopher graduated from Moody Bible Institute in 2005, Wheaton College Graduate School in 2007 with a Master of Arts in Biblical Exegesis and received his doctorate of ministry in 2014 from Bethel Seminary. Dr. Yuan’s newest book is Holy Sexuality and the Gospel: Sex, Desire, and Relationships Shaped by God’s Grand Story.

Chris' Website: https://christopheryuan.com/

title: How Near Death Experiences Point to an Afterlife | Interview with Dr. Gary Habermas (Ep. #50)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Dr. Gary Habermas about how Near Death Experiences (NDE's) point to God. We talk about what a NDE is, how they point to God, answering objections, and more. Come join us!

Dr. Gary Habermas has taught at the college, seminary, and graduate-level for over 40 years. He is also an author or editor of some 37 books, of which 18 are on the subject of Jesus’ resurrection. Other published subjects include religious doubt, personal suffering, and near-death experiences. Among these books are The Historical Jesus (College Press, 1996), Beyond Death (with J.P. Moreland, Crossway, 1998), and The Case for the Resurrection of Jesus (with Michael Licona, Kregel, 2004). He has also contributed more than sixty chapters or articles to additional books, plus has published well over 100 articles or reviews in journals and other publications.

Dr. Habermas' Website: https://www.garyhabermas.com/

description:

Jay has an MA in Cognitive Psychology, an M.Div in Apologetics, Ethics, and Biblical Studies and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Social and Personality Psychology from Baylor University.

title: Sharing the Gospel with Jehovah's Witnesses | Interview with Lindsey Medenwaldt (Ep. #48)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Lindsey about how we as Christians can reach Jehova's Witnesses. We talk about the history of the Jehova's Witnesses, what they believe, and how we as Christians can share the Gospel with them. 

Lindsey is the Executive Director of Mama Bear Apologetics. She has been writing a world religion blog for Mama Bear for the past two years, and she also contributed a chapter about the Jehovah's Witnesses for the forthcoming (March 2021) Harvest House book "The Popular Handbook of World Religions."

Lindsey has a master's in apologetics and ethics from Denver Seminary, as well as a master's in public administration from Midwestern State University and a law degree from St. Mary's School of Law. She is married to fellow apologist Jay Medenwaldt and they reside in Waco, Texas with their three daughters.

Follow Lindsey: https://twitter.com/LMedenwaldt?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor

title: Why This Jew Converted to Christianity | Interview with Jeff Kran (Ep. #46)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Jeff Kran about his journey to becoming a Christian. We talk about his conversion, why Jesus is the Messiah, answering objections, and more!

Jeff Kran is a Jewish believer who was born in Chicago in 1962 and raised by secular Jewish parents. However, he was greatly influenced by his Orthodox Jewish grandfather who lived with them for some years and made sure that Jeff had the basis of a Jewish education. Jeff came to faith in 1982 through a study of the evidence for the truth of Scripture - particularly Messianic prophecy. Since then, he has been
active in Bible teaching, conference speaking and congregation planting.

Jeff's Website: http://www.zionsbanner.org/
Jeff's YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/jeffkranzionsbanner

title: Turning your Apologetics into Evangelism | Interview with Sam Casado (Ep. #44)
description:
In this conversation, I talk with Sam about the importance of apologetics pertaining to evangelism. We talk about practically using your apologetics knowledge and the importance of trusting God.

Samuel Hubner Casado used to work in Dutch entertainment as an actor and singer, but left the industry in his mid-twenties when he acutely developed severe hyperhidrosis. Today, he is one of the Netherlands’ most prominent videogame critics, while working as the team lead for one of Canada's largest YouTube channels. He recently reaffirmed his Christian faith and renewed his passion for the Word of God, apologetics, eschatology, and evangelism.

title: Old Testament Slavery from an Agnostic's Perspective | Interview with Dr. Josh Bowen (Ep. #43)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Dr. Josh about understanding some key aspects of the Old Testament. We talk about Genesis, Slavery, and more. Come join us!

Dr. Joshua Bowen graduated from the Johns Hopkins University in 2016, with a Ph.D. in Assyriology. He wrote his dissertation on the lamentations liturgies of the city of Kiš, and specializes in the Sumerian language. Josh was awarded the Deutscher Akademischer Austauschdienst (D.A.A.D.) and Fulbright scholarship during the 2014-2015 academic year, allowing him to spend the year in Tubingen, Germany, working with Dr. Konrad Volk on his dissertation project.

As well as his Ph.D., Josh holds a B.S. in Religion from Liberty University, a Th.M. in the Old Testament from Capital Bible Seminary, and a M.A. in Near Eastern Studies from the Johns Hopkins University. Prior to entering academia, Joshua was a chaplain in the U.S. Airforce where he also gained an A.A. in Avionics.

Dr. Josh's Book on Did the Old Testament Endorse Slavery: https://www.amazon.com/Did-Old-Testam...

Dr. Josh's Website: https://www.digitalhammurabi.com/

title: Evidence for The Soul | Interview with Eric Hernandez (Ep. #41)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Eric Hernandez about the philosophy of mind and evidence for the soul. We look at some of the evidence for the soul, answering common objections,  and a live q&a at the end! Come join us!

Eric Hernandez is a dynamic evangelist and apologist with a heart for proclaiming the gospel and defending his faith on theological and philosophical grounds. He is a licensed minister, certified formation therapist, and the Apologetics Lead for The Baptist General Convention of Texas.

title: Dealing with Doubts | A Conversation with John Dunfee (Ep. #40)
description:
John Dunfee has been focusing some of his research on how Christians should deal with their doubts. In this conversation, I talk with John about how as Christians we should deal with our doubts!

John Dunfee is a young adult who came to faith in true Christianity through apologetics. John has been studying apologetics for the past five years and hopes to put his studies to use. His main target is to equip young Christian teenagers in order to prepare them for defending their faith and answering questions for those who ask.

description:

title: Why Dr. Josh Bowen Left Christianity and Could He Come Back? | Interview with Josh Bowen (Ep. #39)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Josh about his journey from Christianity to agnosticism along with asking him some questions about his view of the Old Testament.

Dr. Joshua Bowen graduated from the Johns Hopkins University in 2016, with a Ph.D. in Assyriology. He wrote his dissertation on the lamentations liturgies of the city of Kiš, and specializes in the Sumerian language. Josh was awarded the Deutscher Akademischer Austauschdienst (D.A.A.D.) and Fulbright scholarship during the 2014-2015 academic year, allowing him to spend the year in Tubingen, Germany, working with Dr. Konrad Volk on his dissertation project.

Timestamps:
0:00 Intro
2:30 Josh's Interest in ANE
4:40 Meaning of Agnosticism 
6:50 Josh's Christian Faith
18:50 Josh's Journey Leaving Faith
29:10 Have Josh's Beliefs Changed Since Leaving Christianity?
32:00 Why Josh Rejected God
37:05 What Would Convince Josh to be a Theist?
40:10 What Would Convince Josh to be a Christian?
47:00 Religious Experience
51:00 Josh on Romans 1
58:15 Marriage with a Christian
1:05:35 What if Christianity is True?
1:09:40 Conclusion

Dr. Josh's Book on Did the Old Testament Endorse Slavery: https://www.amazon.com/Did-Old-Testament-Endorse-Slavery/dp/1734358637/ref=mp_s_a_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=did+the+old+testament+endorse+slavery&qid=1591745419&sprefix=did+the+old+testament+&sr=8-1

Dr. Josh's Website: https://www.digitalhammurabi.com/

title: Do Miracles Happen? A Faith Healer Responds | Interview with Ken Fish (Ep. #27)
description:
In this interview, I talk with Ken Fish about miracles. In this interview, Ken talks about his own experiences in witnessing miracles and answering common objections from atheists regarding miracles. 

Since 2010, Ken's has begun ministering intensively in Australia, working alongside churches as diverse as Anglican, Assembly of God, Baptist, Catholic, Foursquare, Lutheran, Methodist, Nazarene, Presbyterian, Vineyard, and non-aligned Pentecostal.  His work includes vision-casting, teaching on leadership and awakening themes, equipping the saints to further the advance of the Kingdom of God, and releasing fresh anointing in the midst of visitation. 

Ken's Ministry: https://kingdomfireministries.org/

In this interview, I talk with Greg Koukl about strategies for sharing your faith with skeptics. Greg wrote the well-known book Tactics on this very topic. In this interview, I talk with Greg about what we should, and shouldn't do when sharing our faith with skeptics. Enjoy! 

Tactics: https://amzn.to/3aNw2HT
Greg's Twitter: https://twitter.com/gregkoukl?lang=en

title: Clement of Rome | Christian History #2
description:
Clement of Rome was one of the most influential figures in the early church. First Clement, written to the Corinthians is also one of the most important early church writings. Clement's writing inspires us to follow Christ with obedience and love.

title: The Amazing Power of The Gospel - Rashawn Copeland Interview (Ep. #24)
description:
In this interview, Zac interviews Rashawn Copeland about the power of the Gospel. 
Rashawn Copeland is an Evangelist, Published Author, and Medical Service Officer in the United States Army. He also currently enrolled in a seminary program at Liberty University. In this interview, Rashawn talks about his own testimony and the liberating power of the Gospel.

title: Presuppositional vs Classical Apologetics | Eli Ayala vs Josiah Batten
description:
In this live discussion, we have Eli Ayala and Josiah Batten discussing presuppositional vs classical apologetics. Eli holds the presuppositional view and Josiah the classical view. Each will give a brief opening statement on their beliefs, then engage in dialogue on the topics for 45 minutes. Then at the end, there will be a discussion on how we can be united as Christians despite theological differences plus a Q&A1

title: Miracles Can Be the Best Explanation (Response to Rationality Rules Part 2)
description:
This video is the second part of my response to Rationality Rules about the argument from miracles. He claims to have debunked the argument from miracles. In this video I argue that skepticism grounded in naturalism fails, we can distinguish a miracle from a natural occurrence, and evidence for miracles can meet and shift the burden of proof to the Atheist. The argument from miracles is definitely not debunked.

title: How Should Christians React to Global Warming? - With Philosopher Mike DeVito (Ep. #21)
description:
Mike DeVito is an NFL veteran who played defensive end for nine years with the New York Jets and Kansas City Cheifs. Most recently, Mike has received Masters's degrees in Philosophical Apologetics from Houston Baptist University and Philosophy, Science and Religion from the University of Edinburgh. In this interview, I talk with Mike about climate change and Mike's recent dissertation on it. Mike argues that we should act as if alarmism is true. We will also be doing a live Q&A at the end, so be sure to ask questions!

title: Constantine the Great: Christian History #1
description:
Constantine the Great lived from around 275 AD to 337 AD and was the Roman Emperor from 306-337 AD. Constantine is most famously known as the first Roman Emperor to become a Christian, who legalized Christianity and played an integral part in the spread of the faith. In 313 AD, he issued the Edict of Milan which legalized Christianity and proclaimed tolerance to all religions in the Roman Empire, which provided a major spark in the growth of Christianity.

She also holds a B.A. in Communications (news media emphasis) from CSUF (Cal State University, Fullerton), and an AA in Christian Studies from Christian Life College, Illinois. She is married, has two children, blogs at Think Divinely, and teaches Apologetics at her church in Wisconsin. Lisa is also the Vice Chair of and Coordinator for WIA's Communications Committee.

title: Live with Ryan Pauly - Missionary to Apologist -  A Brief Case for Christianity (Ep. #11)
description:
Ryan Pauly graduated in 2010 with a B.A. of Religion and an emphasis in Youth Leadership from Vanguard University of Southern California. After graduating he became a missionary in the Dominican Republic. During his four years of living in the Dominican Republic; he taught English, Worldview, Apologetics, and Leadership to junior high and high school students.

Ryan moved back to Southern California in 2015 and started teaching Historical Christian Doctrine and Apologetics, Comparative Religions and Worldviews, and Philosophy of Ethics at a Southern California Christian high school. In 2017, Ryan joined MAVEN as a field guide for their worldview missions experiences and became a trained volunteer apologist for the Reasons to Believe apologetics community. In 2019, Ryan became a Stand to Reason affiliate.

Ryan received his Master’s degree in Christian apologetics from Talbot School of Theology. He also holds a certificate in Science Apologetics from the Reasons Institute.

His writing has been featured at crossexamined.org, seanmcdowell.org, thepoachedegg.net, apologetics.com, josh.org, and he is also a contributor for the updated version of the popular Apologetics Study Bible for Students which released in 2017. Along with his writing, Ryan has appeared as a guest on Truth Matters TV

I stole this bio from his website, but it is great!
